ovdesc.p: T24 currently has multiple methods to identify the unique session number for a given port. This varies from the SESSION.NO common variable to @USERNO jBase variable. There is lack of consistency and there is no single and central controlling mechanism for the session number.

To overcome this, it is decided that T24 on its entry point will allocate a number which is unique to the T24 session . There are two entry points to T24. One is T24.INITIALISE which allows online access to T24 (viz. tSS/JCA/Classic and Desktop Sessions do this). The other entry point to T24 is tSA which is the service agent that runs/monitors the various services that run in T24.
The idea is to merge these into one and introduce a session number allocation mechanism
The record created will get deleted once the user logs off or the session gracefully expires.
